inlineContent.text: Access
- An association between user and locking device. Authorizes the user to execute operations on the locking device.
Activation
- Event of accepting an invitation, leading to the activation of an Operating Device.
Claiming
- Process in which locking device is taken into use by giving it predefined unique name so the device can be recognized in the system. Claiming is done by the application.
Firmware
- A software running on the locking device.
Invitation
- A request for an operating device to join the platform. Once accepted, the device is activated.
Locking Device
- A physical device. Holds an operational and manufacturing certificates. Operating devices can execute operations on it. Examples: BEAT/Cumulus Padlock, Controller, Key deposit.
Operating Device
- Can interact with locking devices, typically a mobile phone.
Personalization
- Giving the locking device a unique identity, in the form of manufacturing and operational certificates.
Platform
- Refers to a collection of microservices running in cloud and the functionality they provide connected to the Cumulus / BEAT product line. Synonyms: backend.
Registration
- The process of creating a User or an Operating Device to the Platform. Users can be created directly while Operating Devices are added through Invitation.
Rekey/Rekeying
- The process of updating locking device certificate. Synonyms: Certificate Update.
Scanning
- Term used for finding nearby BLE locking devices. Synonyms: Lock Discovering.
System
- Represents an organization/customer using the platform. Everything on the platform belongs to a system, except the special integrator users.
User
- An entity that can be authenticated to use platform APIs. It could either be a human being or an access control system.
